entry.title: The Ministry of Defence Police (Performance) Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations establish procedures in respect of unsatisfactory performance or attendance of members of the Ministry of Defence Police force of the rank of chief superintendent or below (excluding probationers in the first year). They apply in relation to unsatisfactory performance or attendance that comes to the attention of the officer’s line manager on or after 6th April 2012.

entry.title: The National Health Service (Charges to Overseas Visitors) (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2012
entry.summary: Regulation 5 of the National Health Service (Charges to Overseas Visitors) (Scotland) Regulations 1989 exempts certain categories of overseas visitors from the requirement to pay for treatment the need for which arose during a visit to the United Kingdom. These Regulations amend Regulation 5 to include within those categories visitors who are taking part or involved in the Olympic or Paralympic Games in 2012. It is anticipated that members of the Games Family will be in Scotland in the period from 16thJuly to 10thAugust 2012, inclusive, for the football matches that are taking place in Glasgow as part of the Games.

entry.title: The Social Security (Categorisation of Earners) (Amendment) Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Social Security (Categorisation of Earners) Regulations 1978 (“the principal Regulations”) and the Social Security (Categorisation of Earners) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1978 (“the principal NI Regulations”) which provide, for the purposes of the Social Security Contributions and Benefits Act 1992 and the Social Security Contributions and Benefits (Northern Ireland) Act 1992, for persons in employments of certain descriptions to be treated as falling within a different category of earners, and specify the person who is to be treated as the secondary contributor in respect of payments to certain description of earners. The amendments made by these Regulations mean the principal Regulations and the principal NI Regulations will no longer apply to lecturers, teachers etc employed at educational establishments.

entry.title: The General Teaching Council for Scotland (Legal Assessor) Rules 2012
entry.summary: These Rules make provision in relation to the functions of legal assessors in the proceedings of the General Teaching Council for Scotland. The existing Rules relating to that matter are revoked.

entry.title: The Education (Student Loans) (Repayment) (Amendment) Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Education (Student Loans) (Repayment) Regulations 2009 (S.I. 2009/470) (“the Principal Regulations”). The Principal Regulations govern the repayment of income-contingent student loans paid to students under section 22 of the Teaching and Higher Education Act 1998.

entry.title: The Energy Performance of Buildings (Certificates and Inspections)(England and Wales)(Amendment) Regulations 2012

ukm:Subject.Value: BUILDING AND BUILDINGS, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: BUILDING AND BUILDINGS, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Energy Performance of Buildings (Certificates and Inspections)(England and Wales) Regulations 2007 (“the 2007 Regulations”).

entry.title: The Social Security (Contributions) (Amendment No. 2) Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Social Security (Contributions) Regulations 2001 (S.I. 2001/1004) (“the principal Regulations”).

entry.title: The Smoke Control Areas (Authorised Fuels) (England) Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations consolidate six sets of regulations which declare fuels to be authorised fuels for the purposes of Part III of the Clean Air Act 1993. Those regulations are SI 2008/514, SI 2008/2342, SI 2009/2191, SI 2010/576, SI 2011/715 and SI 2011/2105. Two additional fuels are authorised (Excel+ briquettes and Newheat briquettes). Briteheat and Stoveheat Premium briquettes are two names for the same product and they are therefore listed together.

entry.title: The Immigration and Nationality (Cost Recovery Fees) Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations, made under sections 51(3), 52(1) and 52(3) of the Immigration, Asylum and Nationality Act 2006, specify fees relating to immigration and nationality. They are made for the purposes of the Immigration and Nationality (Fees) Order 2011 (S.I. 2011/445), which sets out the applications, services and processes related to immigration and nationality for which fees may be specified in regulations.

entry.title: The Criminal Justice Act 2003 (Commencement No. 27) Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order brings into force on 19th March 2012 section 29(1) to (3) and (5) and section 30 of the Criminal Justice Act 2003 for the purposes of allowing the following public prosecutors to institute criminal proceedings by issuing a written charge and requisition:

entry.title: The Smoke Control Areas (Exempted Fireplaces) (England) Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order revokes and replaces with amendments the Smoke Control Areas (Exempted Fireplaces) (England) (No 2) Order 2011 (S.I. 2011/2106).

entry.title: The Trafford Healthcare National Health Service Trust (Dissolution) Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order provides for the dissolution on 1st April 2012 of the Trafford Healthcare National Health Service Trust established on 8th February 1994 and revokes the Trafford Healthcare National Health Service Trust (Establishment) Order 1994 that established the trust.

entry.title: The National Savings Bank (Investment Deposits) (Limits) (Amendment) Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order amends the National Savings Bank (Investment Deposits) (Limits) Order 1977 (S.I. 1977/1210) by increasing, from £5,340 to £5,640, the annual amount which can be accepted by the Director of Savings from any person by way of deposit in an individual savings account at the National Savings Bank.

entry.title: The A1 Trunk Road (Elkesley Junctions Improvement) Order 2012
entry.summary: This order authorises the construction of two new two-way slip roads linking the A1 Trunk Road with side roads which the Secretary of State proposes to build under a separate Side Roads Order. The new slip roads will be trunk roads. Together, the new slip roads and the new side roads will constitute a grade-separated (two-level) junction the construction of which will enable the Secretary of State to close the existing A1 junctions at Jockey Lane / Cross Lane and High Street / Coalpit Lane.

entry.title: The Social Security (Contributions) (Re-rating) Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order, which comes into force on 6th April 2012, increases the rates of Class 2 and Class 3 contributions specified in sections 11(1) and 13(1) of the Social Security Contributions and Benefits Act 1992 (“the Act”) from £2.50 to £2.65 and from £12.60 to £13.25. It also increases the amount of earnings specified in section 11(4) of the Act, below which an earner may be excepted from liability for Class 2 contributions from £5,315 to £5,595 (Articles 2 and 3).

entry.title: The Social Security (Contributions) (Limits and Thresholds) (Amendment) Regulations 2012

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Social Security (Contributions) (Limits and Thresholds) (Amendment) Regulations 2012

entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Social Security (Contributions) Regulations 2001 (“the principal Regulations”).

entry.title: The Infrastructure Planning (Environmental Impact Assessment) (Amendment) Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Infrastructure Planning (Environmental Impact Assessment) Regulations 2009 (“the 2009 Regulations”). The 2009 Regulations implemented, in relation to nationally significant infrastructure projects, the Directive on the assessment of the effects of certain public and private projects on the environment.

entry.title: The Barts Health National Health Service Trust (Establishment) and the Barts and The London National Health Service Trust, the Newham University Hospital National Health Service Trust and the Whipps Cross University Hospital National Health Service Trust (Dissolution) Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order establishes the Barts Health National Health Service Trust as a National Health Service trust.

entry.title: The Qualifying Care Relief (Specified Social Care Schemes) (Amendment) Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order amends the Qualifying Care Relief (Specified Social Care Schemes) Order 2011 (S.I. 2011/712) (“the 2011 Order”).

entry.title: The Valuation Tribunal (Amendment) Rules (Northern Ireland) 2012
entry.summary: The Valuation Tribunal Rules (Northern Ireland) 2007 (S.R. 2007 No.182) (“the principal Rules”) regulate the exercise of rights of appeal to the Northern Ireland Valuation Tribunal (“the Tribunal”) and prescribe the practice and procedure in relation to proceedings before the Tribunal.
